intro: Ouratea unilateralis, commonly known as the single-sided ouratea, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, often asymmetrical leaves that give it its common name. Its small, fragrant flowers are typically white or pale yellow and are arranged in clusters. Ouratea unilateralis is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
